data.chText: 离开（工作职位、学校等）；离任；离校
data.enText: to leave your job, school, etc.
If I don't get more money I'll quit.

data.chText: 他已决定辞掉球队经理的职务。
data.enText: He has decided to quit as manager of the team.

data.chText: 去年他因身体欠佳而退出了表演。
data.enText: He quit the show last year because of bad health.

data.chText: 我们才刚刚开始，现在决不放弃。
data.enText: We only just started. We're not going to quit now.
to leave the place where you live

data.chText: 当时我们决定，该离开城市生活了。
data.enText: We decided it was time to quit the city.

data.chText: 房东通知他们都搬出去。
data.enText: The landlord gave them all notice to quit .

data.chText: 关闭，退出（计算机程序等）
data.enText: to close a computer program or application

means: 关闭，退出（计算机程序等）

ex.chText: 他抛弃了妻子，拿走了他们所有的钱财。
ex.enText: He abandoned his wife and took all their money.

ex.chText: 船长向所有人下令放弃正在燃烧的船只。
ex.enText: The captain ordered everyone to abandon the burning ship.

synonyms.bx: 强调永远并完全放弃，不论自愿与否，也可能是为了逃避责任。

ex.enText: The Queen has no intention of abdicating her throne.

ex.chText: 英王爱德华八世于1936年退位。
他抛弃妻子后，和一位日本姑娘结婚了。
ex.enText: He deserted his wife and married a Japanese girl.

ex.chText: 那位母亲生下男婴后不久就把他遗弃了。
ex.enText: The mother deserted the baby boy soon after giving birth.

synonyms.bx: 多指放弃从前的职业、伙伴、伴侣及监护人资格等，有时带有内疚感。

ex.chText: 他取消了访问纽约的决定。
ex.enText: He has given up his decision to visit New York.

synonyms.bx: 普通用语，强调终止做某事，通常用来表示放弃某个计划、设计、工作、职位等。

ex.chText: 如果不给我加薪，我就不干了。
ex.enText: If I don't get a pay rise, I'll quit.

synonyms.bx: 常指停止做于己不利或伤害他人的事。

ex.chText: 他正式声明放弃公民权利。
她宣布放弃自己的宗教信仰。

synonyms.bx: 表示正式声明放弃职位、官衔、权力等。

ex.chText: 他只好放弃在议会的投票权。
ex.enText: He had to waive his right to vote in Parliament.

ex.chText: 地方政府拒绝取缔其规定。
ex.enText: The local government refused to waive its rules.

synonyms.bx: 表示正式宣布放弃权利、要求，或宣布取消规则、规定等。

tr: give up in the face of defeat of lacking hope
example: In the second round, the challenger gave up

tr: give up or retire from a position
example: The Secretary of the Navy will leave office next month
The chairman resigned over the financial scandal

tr: put an end to a state or an activity

value.boxr_value: The form quit is used in the present tense and is the past tense and past participle. quit 的过去式和过去分词与原形相同。

value.def: If you quit your job, you choose to leave it.

example.ex: He quit his job as an office boy in Athens...
example.tran: 他辞去了在雅典当办公室勤杂工的工作。

example.ex: He figured he would quit before Johnson fired him.
example.tran: 他估计自己会在约翰逊炒他鱿鱼之前先辞职。

value.def: If you quit an activity or quit doing something, you stop doing it.

example.ex: A nicotine spray can help smokers quit the habit without putting on weight...
example.tran: 尼古丁喷雾剂能够帮助吸烟者在不增加体重的同时戒烟。

example.ex: I was trying to quit smoking at the time.

value.def: If you quit a place, you leave it completely and do not go back to it.

example.ex: ...the idea that humans might one day quit the earth to colonise other planets...
example.tran: 人类有朝一日可能会离开地球到其他星球定居繁衍的想法

example.ex: Police were called when he refused to quit the building.
example.tran: 他拒绝离开那座大楼，于是人们叫来了警察。

value.def: If you say that you are going to call it quits, you mean that you have decided to stop doing something or being involved in something.

example.ex: They raised $630,000 through listener donations, and then called it quits...
example.tran: 他们通过听众捐款的方式筹集了63万美元后宣告结束。

example.ex: You can decide whether there is hope in working for mutual happiness, or if you should call it quits.
example.tran: 你可以决定是否有希望为双方共同的幸福努力，或者就此一刀两断。

rootsaffixes.indicate: = to free, to release 使自由；免除
rootsaffixes.title: quit

partsOfSpeech.dec: ac 加强 + quit 使自由；免除 →〔疑犯〕获得自由 → 免罪
ac 表加强 + quit 使自由；免除 + tal，acquit 的名词 → 释放；还清（债）

partsOfSpeech.d: 停止；放弃（为获得自由而放弃）

partsOfSpeech.dec: quit 使自由；免除 + claim 宣告 → 放弃宣告的权利 → 放弃权利
re 回 + quit 使自由；免除 + e → 回头使〔恩人〕自由 → 报答
re 回 + quit 使自由；免除 + al 表行为，requite的名词 → 报答
